website_summaries.verdict: Whether you're camping with a bunch of friends or just prefer a spacious tent, you will likely be impressed with its quality and features.
pros: Its durable build, spacious interior, gear loft, and privacy panels make it the most versatile tent for serious campers
Holds up to rain and wind very well
cons: Zippered screen covers are slightly difficult to close
Due to its large size, it is challenging to take down and put in the storage bag

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent for the money. Very spacious. With the rainfly, airflow is limited. Biggest gripe and why I took off a star: WHEN DESIGNER’S DECIDE HOW BIG A STORAGE BAG NEEDS TO BE, THEY NEED TO ADD 20% MORE SPACE TO THE BAG. I spent about 20 minutes in freezing rain, cursing Core 9 while trying to get the tent back in the the tiny storage bag. Bag could stand to be much bigger. Especially if you want to throw in some decent tent spikes (i.e. not what ships with the tent) and a mallet. But now that I have that off my chest, this tent really is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tent
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tent! Comfortably slept a family of six (mother-in-law included), easily set up in the dark, and kept us dry during a surprise shower! Can not recommend enough! Bonus: other campers came over to marvel at it's size and awesomeness, making my husband feel like the King of The Campground.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hassle

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the $ I paid.
customer_reviews.text: Roomy and was easy to set up. Held up to some moderate winds and heavy rains. We did spray it with some Nikwax for added waterproofing- does have some - but sides definitely need some extra help after awhile. No leaks and seems are re enforced nicely too. Great airflow and the height is perfect for not banging your head or having to duck. So far it's held up to two rowdy dogs, two preteens and multi state campsites. Good investment
customer_reviews.author: D Hano

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent for the money. Plenty of room with some high end tent features at a bargain price. Fast and easy to setup. The port in for and extension cord is a nice feature for modern family camping. I agree with other reviews that ventilation is not great. I would definitely recommend for the occasional family camper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after just one, short use
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this tent ripped after one short and gentle use. Amazon (as always) were extremely quick to reply to my complaint and are issuing a refund on return of the tent. Can't fault their customer service. I can fault this tent though, very poor quality. But then it's cheap so I should have ponied up for a more expensive tent. Would ha e expected to to last more than one short night though!
customer_reviews.author: Bunny77

customer_reviews.title: But It Now - The Best Tent in Countless Ways
customer_reviews.text: Great tent from the first set-up. Easy to assemble and can handle flash flooding rainstorms. We had a 4 much rainstorm this weekend and had to leave in a hurry as they were closing roads so the video attached is part of drying out. My 10-year old son and I can assemble it in 20 minutes! It is super rooming and for 4 people it is perfect with cots and gear.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Werder

customer_reviews.title: Not good for warm or rainy weather.
customer_reviews.text: Great layout, lots of room but there is no ventilation on the sides where you sleep. Needs zipable windows. Door zipper makes it hard to get in and out fast and zipper constantly got stuck in the over-flap. First time out it rained and there was a small lake in our tent, even after we used an extra tarp on the bottom and were sheltered by trees. We only lasted 2 out of our 3 night trip.
customer_reviews.author: Bells

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge and was perfect for the guys camping trip in the mountains. It rained almost all day the first day, and everything in the tent stayed dry. Would have been nice if the rain fly extended a little further out over the door, but otherwise it met expectations nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Bug

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level tent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent last summer for several family camping trips (Nebraska and Utah). It fit two adults and four kids with plenty of room and stood up well to a few rain storms and moderate winds. It doesn't have the best ventilation when the rain fly is on. You need to stake out all the rainfly lines to keep the rainfly off the tent fabric and maximize ventilation. The top is mostly mesh so you don't have much privacy with the rainfly off but you do get a great view of the night sky. Great value for the money (bought at 102$). Reserving a 5 star after seeing how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: erturn

customer_reviews.title: ... up for the first time an there was a bad storm. High winds we did not get wet ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought tent put it up for the first time an there was a bad storm. High winds we did not get wet or blowed away. It had plenty of room we liked the tent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great price
customer_reviews.text: Tested this tent out twice this summer and had a great experience. Set up was simple and self explanatory. Also taking down the tent and packing is was very easy. Very spacious... was able to comfortably sleep the whole family (2 adults, 2 toddlers, 2 big dogs). Fits a queen-sized air mattress, 1 cot and blanket for the dogs while still having space to walk and keep our bags. I am 6 ft and can stand up straight which is also a nice feature. I did not get to test the tent out in the rain yet. If I have any issues on our next trip I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Laskaris

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim before a Cub Scout camping trip. They normally supply small tents, but I liked the size of this one. The tent is huge! It rained all 3 days without a drop getting into the tent! I had to keep the rain fly up the entire time, so it was warm in the tent (outside temps were over 100° every day). It set up really easily. The supplied stakes are pretty wimpy so I bought some upgraded ones. Only real complaint is that without the rain cover, there's no privacy in the tent because of all the screens, and windows don't close.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tent
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy with this tent! We aren’t super outdoorsy, but my husband wanted to do some backyard camping with our son. We looked at more expensive ones at other retailers but ultimately decided we should start slow and get a cheaper model. We are so glad we went with this one! It takes just a few minutes for my husband to put up by himself and it’s very spacious so they can have an inflatable mattress and other room to move around. It’s nice to have the open air panels for a breeze at night and it is well-constructed overall. It feels like it will last and the price is so good.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fossett

customer_reviews.title: Two poles broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: Well, at first glance I had really high hopes here... The reviews were stellar and when i opened it up, it seemed of high quality. First off, the good, the tent is roomy and easy to set up and has great features at it's price point. Unfortunately after the FIRST USE in my yard of all places, one pole completely split and one metal connecter snapped. We certainly were not extra "rough" or anything of the like, as i've been camping for years and know how to put up and take down a tent properly. Maybe I got some defective poles, not sure what the issue is. Best of the luck to other buyers!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall
customer_reviews.text: Good tent overall. Fairly easy setup. Comes in nice packaging and feels premium. It kept bugs out. It has decent airflow if you want it. Definitely could fit three queens but with minimal walking room. Fit two twins with plenty of space for our two dogs, and luggage. It has two pockets built in on either side of the tent that allow for easy storage of things such as a flashlight. The tent has a place to hang a lantern inside at the top. In my experience, this tent didn't collect as much moisture inside of it as other tents used by our family. I'd say this is a good tent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Elayne Randall

customer_reviews.title: This is nice looking tent
customer_reviews.text: This is nice looking tent! Roomy, but not to complicated in setting it up. Why only 3 stars: new tent leaked during first use. It was heavy summer shower, about two hours long. This was the only one which leaked and needed a tarp over the tent. 2 years old CORE 6 person Dome and a 7 years old Columbia tent, both did fine, no leak.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim T.

customer_reviews.title: Buy hvy duty stakes!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad tent.Stricktly watm weather.No for hvy duty backwoods camping.But was fine for our trip.Im gonna use it on a real camping trip soon and see how it holds up.IF YOU BUY THIS ORDER PLENTY OF HVY DUTY TENT STAKES,THE PROVIDED STAKES ARE FLIMSY. Easy to put up,and even essier to put away.enty of room for to cots and gear and 2 adults.9 people?ehhh maybe if they re munchkins.My rule of thumb is half listed capicity.9 person,approx 4-5persons and gear.Good tent.Hope it holds up.Oh also its water resistant not wat.proof.Thinking about wat. Proofing it tho.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Tent
customer_reviews.text: We are a tall family of 4 (12 year old boy & 9 year old girl). This tent was great, bigger than expected. Plenty of room for a queen size air mattress, 2 twin mattress pads and our stuff. It stays cool with lots of ventilation. We didn’t have the opportunity to be in it without the fly (we were in the woods), but it would be very cool to do that because the top is almost all netting. We reinforced the seams prior to use with the Colman seam sealer. We didn’t experience any rain, so can’t make statements about leakage. Glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: JSD

customer_reviews.title: Get Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I typically never take the time to write reviews, but I feel it was needed for this tent. The tent is huge, and perfect for my family, however the first time we took it down, one of the poles broke. I was a bit annoyed at this until I called customer service. The rep I talked to was very polite and knowledgeable. Replacement parts were sent same day. Because of their great customer service, I would order again.
customer_reviews.author: katelin lyons

customer_reviews.title: Just don't buy this tent.
customer_reviews.text: The tent we got is junk. The tent poles are cheap. Ours split the first time we put the tent up, which was super annoying since we were on a multi-day camping trip. The stitching is also poor - the seams rip very easily - and the zipper pulls started unraveling almost immediately, which is a problem since you kinda need those to get in and out of the tent. I mean, repairing some of these problems is easy, but I expect to be able to use a product for more than a few hours before I have to start repairing it. We're waiting for a replacement in case this was an anomaly, but I wouldn't pay for this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tent is big yet still fairly easy to set up even by myself though definitely much easier with 2 people. The tent has survived wind, rain and hail so far. I'm a little worried about the floor as others have mentioned, but it has held up through 2 week long trips so far without issue - we'll see long term...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ebersole

customer_reviews.title: Spacious, but 2 broken bungee cords in poles and leaky seams
customer_reviews.text: We love how spacious this is. It is fairly waterproof and keep us dry on one trip, but now the seams around the base/edge of the tent are leaking, leading to puddling inside the tent in a recent storm. I am very cautious with assembling and taking down the poles, but two bungee cords have broken and I have had a hard time replacing them. The floor, fabric, mesh and zippers seem sturdy. The door zippers get caught a bit on the guard fabric. If it weren't for the seams leaking and the poles, we would love this tent.
customer_reviews.author: trickeration

customer_reviews.title: Bonus points for fitting back all back in the back easily.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say for the durability and weatherproofing of this tent -- but simply for the fact that my husband and I just did a practice pitch, and didn't file for divorce -- I give it 5 stars. Bonus points for fitting back all back in the bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: MommySkinnyKid

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, reasonable price. Stays dry inside during rain, sufficient ventilation. Would like to see more pockets inside and maybe even some kind of hooks for a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Nofyfb

customer_reviews.title: Really nice big tent
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a camping trip with my grandson and a few friends and it was really nice. At first set up was a pain because I had not camped for a long time but once I remembered how to set up a tent it was a piece of cake. More of a pain to get it all packed back up then to set it up. The rain cover worked good and love all the breeze ways you can open or close. Very spacious inside, plenty of room for everything. It was actually bigger than I thought and almost regretted not getting a couple of smaller ones instead but worked well and I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lowder

customer_reviews.title: What a great tent! It is enormous
customer_reviews.text: What a great tent! It is enormous! I love the ceiling, which is total screen, so at night, you can't see the screen at all, but only the beautiful stars! It has a rain tarp to cover the screen if needed. It is very easy to set up and take down. (I am a 53 year old woman and I did it myself). The only trouble I had was getting it back into the bag. It did fit, but it took a few tries to fold it correctly. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: L. Pacitto

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, large but damaged tent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the tent for my family to camp out. Set up the tent for the first time and it set up incredibly easy. Clear instructions and lightweight. It was great for about 3 hrs then the wind picked up a little bit outside. No worries, but we did notice that the tent seemed to be collapsing on itself with each new gust. We carefully began to take the tent down fearing that the night might be rained out when we noticed the culprit- A shattered main tent rod. For the amount of money I spent on this tent I did not expect it to break after only a few hours of use. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mbland97

customer_reviews.title: Great in cool/cold.  Caution 4 warm/hot
customer_reviews.text: Really great tent .. no problems in cooler rainy mountains, but serious bug issued in higher temp/humidity conditions... The small gnats aka noseeums literally fly in droves right thru window mesh and bit us all night.. had to cover w rainfly in temps too hot for fly to limit the invasion. Tent truly would be truly awesome if the had micro mesh. Bottom line... Awesome cool/cold weather tent but not for summer areas where mosquitoes or gnats are a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The rainfly was far from waterproof or resistant, a heavy downpour and the fact that the rainfly allowed pools on the very top we got washed out, but I added a waterproof tarp and it is fine, but on the positive side it is huge for the price. The bottom is waterproof and durable for a good bit of wear and tear, the pockets and gear loft is great. Everything is going so far after about 8 campouts in southern kentucky fall weather.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fuller

customer_reviews.title: I was wanting better quality.
customer_reviews.text: As I was assembling this for the first time, one of the poles shattered in my hand. Leaving fiberglass splinters in my palm and fingers. I contacted the company, no one responded. I bought last year on prime day and had just recently assembled it to find it was faulty. Other than the pole, its huge and easy to assemble. I want to replace with steel poles, which will have to happen before we go camping now. Since I am now down a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: An amazing tent!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this tent! It was totally water resistant and air flowed through it for great ventilation. We pitched it on our dock at a lake! The only issue we had was we had two air mattresses as well as a bunk cot and because it is domed in design it limited how we could layout the inside due to the height and size of bunk cot. Other then that, we are very happy with our purchase!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 3 years in, going strong
customer_reviews.text: Had this tent for 3 years now, use it about 4-6 times a year camping around the state. We have been very impressed. There has been no rips or defects in the tent and while we aren't rough on it, we sure don't baby it either. Large screen roof is perfect on hot days and clear nights, lots and lots of room inside, we have used just about every feature this tent offers and have found them all to be well built. Cant recommend enough! I will definitely be re buying this when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but missing an essential part
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent and served me very well during a hunting trip that saw some serious torrential rainfalls. I gave it 3 stars because when I first tried to assemble this tent, one of the fiberglass tent poles was missing a ferrule. Thankfully I set this tent up a week prior in my backyard and discovered the problem. I bought a tent repair kit on amazon that had the exact ferrule I needed and all was well.
customer_reviews.author: iyaoyasao2

customer_reviews.title: Roomy but didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: We fit four camping cots in this tent with some room to spare. The roof of the tent is mesh but with the rain cover on it the tent doesn’t vent heat very effectively. The rain cover leaked on our second use of the tent and soaked our gear. Long story short, we got approximately 6 nights of use from two trips before we threw this tent in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: SOUTHERLAND

customer_reviews.title: HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: HUGE! This tent is awesome for our family of four. We fit two queen size mattresses into the tent with an empty space in the middle of the tent (the size of another queen mattress) for storing bags and space to play (we have a 2 year old and 4 year old). This has changed our camping experience and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!!
customer_reviews.text: We broke a pole setting up our previous tent right before a camping trip. Needed something fast, yet affordable. After researching we settled on this one and couldn't be happier. We have used it twice and have been rained on multiple times, with no leaks. Love the small area at the top for storage. Only complaint would be that the rain fly steaks are numerous and tend to stick out farther than our previous tent... need to get something to mark them to remind us they are there. On one of our smaller sites, we tripped over them numerous times.
customer_reviews.author: A2MomTo3

customer_reviews.title: Huge tent but the tent poles were broken
customer_reviews.text: Just got my tent yesterday and decided to set it up outside. First thing I noticed was how big it was long ways. Could easily fit 6 adults, maybe more. Unfortunately when i pulled out the tent poles, i found that the elastic on one of the bigger tent poles was torn. Bummer. So I gave up and decided to return it. Im gonna get the smaller one cuz this one was too big for us.
customer_reviews.author: michomeow

customer_reviews.title: Great product and is very easily put together.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two boys and I to camp (first time in a tent). We had a full size and twin size air mattress, with plenty of space to spare. Super easy to put together (you do need two sets of hands to do it with more ease, but could be done alone). Our camping trip was three nights long, and it rained every.single.day. Not one drop of water made it to the inside!! Very pleasantly pleased. I love the window on the back side! The only reason I gave it a 4 is because the zipper does get caught once in a while, which can be annoying when trying to go in/out quickly with the rain!!
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Bought 3 years ago. Holding up great. No issues with zippers or tears. We do tarp over our tent if we know rain is coming. We have had rain without tarps and it was fine. We did not waterproof the seams. Last year torential rain where we had to dig trenches around our tent to divert water.....tent stayed dry despite lots of wet ground and water all around. Spacious. Pics are a queen size air mattress and a cot on opposite sides of tent with plenty of room still in the middle. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my daughter and I. It is definitely large for just the 2 of us and the dog. It is pretty easy to put up by myself. In other reviews people complain about the cover not cover the mesh all the way.. I didn't have this problem. There is velcro on each of the poles and the cover. If you use the steaks to tie down the cover it covers it completely. It also allows a little more air to come in. I think my biggest complaint would be lack of air flow because there are only windows on front and back.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Summer Tent
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room set up and tear down easy. Weight is good easy to handle. Would recommend having tent base tie downs in the middle of each end but works as is. Storage bag is generous for storage without a hassel. This is a light summer or mild weather tent not an all season tent and definitely not for any winter outing. Tent pegs are small and would recommend a stronger peg for super windy sites..
customer_reviews.author: PRR

customer_reviews.title: Survived a heavy rain storm!
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of wind storms and rain storms where we camp and this last summer we had some pretty gnarly ones. We planned ahead and pitched the tent where it would have some protection from the wind and made sure we used heavy duty stakes, but it still got quite a battering from the wind. There was no damage whatsoever. The rain was the worst I've seen there, but barely any got inside the tent with the rain guard on.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: Ok so got the tent for my camping trip this weekend, put it up in back yard and this thing is massive, feels like good quality but we shall see what kind of weather it holds up to, did need my daughter to help me with the holding of poles while putting up, does need 2 people. I will do another review after this weekend! But I am very happy so far with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne marais

customer_reviews.title: Slept family of 5
customer_reviews.text: This tent was great for our camping trip! We fit three blow up mattresses and slept 5 comfortably. The mattresses were a queen size and two twins. We were in there just to sleep and change so it was enough room. It was easy to get in and out of and the screened "windows" gave for a nice breeze to circulate through. Assembling is always tricky but with some help it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: First night rain like I have never seen
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent to the Outer Banks NC. First night rain like I have never seen. We only had a few very small puddles in the tent half cup at most. Would like be able to close vents(windows) on each end of tent. It would make it more wind proof. All in all very satisfied. Oh and the camp ranger asked where we purchased it because it was the only one left standing after the storm. She wanted to purchase one for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is impressive. It is much larger in the inside than it looks. Set up is very easy (just 4 poles). We are going camping in a few weeks so I will give an update, but the quality is very nice especially at this price point. We are a family of 4 Me, My Wife, 5 yr old, and 1 yr old) We wanted a larger tent to fit cots and a portable Crib for our 1 yr old. This tent is perfect for that with room to spare!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Had it for two nights in the Smokey Mountains @ 5500’ above sea level. Rained both nights, one was very heavy. It held up great. No wind during the storms so not an exhaustive review. Minus one star for typical week wire type steaks and the rain fly is not self aligning. It must be adjusted for proper coverage and privacy. Overall great family tent for the price. Be aware of its dimensions, it ain’t tiny.
customer_reviews.author: tuba

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tent!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we were looking for, we have a little family and need a little space while we camp. It sets up easy and fast and its durable! Even when the weather isn't great it helps keep heat in and blocks the wind and rain well. It's got a good height and makes it to where we can actually comfortably stand up inside. Can't beat the price for what you get, we're beyond happy with our tent!
customer_reviews.author: Krugs

customer_reviews.title: It's Huuuge!
customer_reviews.text: First time set up took about 25 minutes...unpacking and reading directions. It is really BIG. I like setting up new tents before first camping trip, so it went really well. I am going to purchase better tent stakes, just to be safe. I actually put it up on a pretty gusty day and left it overnight, and it is a beaut! Easy take down, but I had a tough time getting it back in the bag. It was quite windy and I suppose I didn't get all of the air removed. Can't wait to use this tent on a real camping adventure. Great family size tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, easy to put up and really worked for our needs. Quality materials. Didn't rain when we used it so I can't speak to that, but it seems like it would definitely keep you dry. I put the tent up and took it down myself with my little 6 year old running around so a single person can definitely do it, but 2 people would of course be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good tent but you almost need 2 people to put it up
customer_reviews.text: Good tent but you almost need 2 people to put it up. Spacious inside. It rained quite a bit on our camping trip and we stayed very dry inside. There was also lots of room for kids to jump around and play games while we waited out the rain. We used it for 2 adults and 2 kids (4 and 7) and a black lab. Could have comfortably fit a couple more adults.
customer_reviews.author: Shlomo

customer_reviews.title: Compact, solid tent
customer_reviews.text: Held up well in some decent wind. It didn't rain when we used it so we kept the rain fly off. I loved how airy it was. Without the rain fly you can see the stars so good. I just wish there was a way to have some privacy without the rain fly on. It is light weight. I couldn't believe how small it packs up. I don't like the extra fabric by the zipper. I did a good job of keeping it from being caught, but my 4 kids (ages 5-11) weren't so careful. Overall I would recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rueckert

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: May as well come with a chandelier, this thing is palatial spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Colt

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great tent
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with this tent. It is a nice big tent. Pretty easy to set up and sturdy. We didn’t have rain so can’t speak to how water resistant. The only thing we didn’t like was that the tent is totally open if the rainfly isn’t on. And even with it on there are some gaps that seem like someone could come under the rain fly and see right in your tent. No a huge issue but felt a little odd.
customer_reviews.author: CJacks

customer_reviews.title: Zipper construction poor.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tent the first time and even the second time I used it but on the third time the door zipper began pulling away from the fabric and caught the zipper. The zipper unthreaded making the tent useless. I would not purchase this again and would spend the extra 10 dollars on a different brand with a more reliable name.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is fantastic! It’s easy to set up, and really well made. Took me about 10 minutes to set up. We easily fit two large inflatable queen size mattresses with a pack-n-play bed in the middle. Still plenty of room to walk around, and store other gear. I was especially happy with the over sized bag that made it easy to put away. For the price, this tent is an unbelievable value.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! I was definitely sceptical because of the price but it’s a great tent. No way I’m sleeping with 8 other people in there but you can fit 2 queen sized mattresses in it. Realistically, probably 6 person max if you want to be comfortable and not sleeping nose to nose with someone. Great construction with thick, durable plastic tarp floor. Nice features and plenty of storage pockets. I’d suggest this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Kimbro

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to put together but once it's up it's awesome! Roomy, comfortable, quality zippers, holds up well with kids using it. I can't comment on rain resistance because we had a tarp over camp but I stayed in it for weeks and didn't have a problem with moisture. I would buy this again without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up with 2 people. Its huge! Fit 3 full size cots and had lots of room for the rest of our stuff. Leaked a little in the corners but it was a good size storm. Stake loop tore almost 1/2 way off right by the door. Door is a little weird to open you have to get it just right. Kids needed assistance getting in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great price big tent that will keep you dry in any weather
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from camping for a week in the Black Hills, first night a severe thunderstorm rolled thru with high winds and a lot of rain, no drips or leaks from the top side and there was so much water running thru our site and under the tent the floor felt like a water bed and still no leaks. We also did have a tarp under the floor. Fit 2 queen air mattresses, a toddler pack and play as well as all our clothes luggage with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: We finally used this tent and I am happy to say, we love it! We had severe rain both nights of our trip and not one drip of water inside! It is massive! We fit 2 full size and 1 queen size air mattresses inside, and still had room in between to walk. The only con is, it is heavy to carry but totally worth it. Setting up was super easy and took my husband and I less than 10 minutes. Love this tent overall and would recommend to anyone who does family camping!
customer_reviews.author: Tomika

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built tent for the but I don't recommend it to be used in the hot summer though. The screen windows aren't very big on the ends and only has one door. You can't beat the price and the quality is impressive. It can handle heavy rainfall and not leak. This is more of a spring fall tent and will be used as such for me again.
customer_reviews.author: HelloHello

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy. Plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: We'll so far so good. It only took about 10-15 minutes to set up. Zippers are a little cheap, so I highly recommend using some caution when zipping/unzipping. I've definitely broken my fair share in the past, from being a little too hasty when closing or opening flaps. Also, you could get nine people in here if you had to. But, I can't guarantee it would be comfortable. We'll see how the 5 of us do. Only time will tell. I will update after the great, summer road trip next month.
customer_reviews.author: MarCorps636

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent
customer_reviews.text: Great for our little family. Easily fit a queen and twin xl air mattress and still had plenty of space for other stuff. Wish it was a tad taller as at 6'4 I couldn't stand in the middle but my wife is 5'10 and had room to spare. It poured two of the nights and we were perfectly dry. Also easy to put up. Took the two of us 5-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Weathered a Large Storm!
customer_reviews.text: We took it camping and a HUGE storm came through. We stayed complete dry and it never blew apart in the wind. I was terrified and extremely impressed at the same time. lol One of our poles broke though and we weren't tugging too hard or anything so that was annoying. Trying to figure out how to get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan H.

customer_reviews.title: An Awesone Tent!! Holds up to Rain!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent as an upgrade from our 4 person tent and it turned out to be the best tent we've ever had! It was perfect for 2 people with plenty of room for our two cots, and totes for personal belongings. The first time we had it out we had a good ol' Black Hills thunderstorm that poured down rain and the rainfly kept us bone dry!! The only thing I recommend is buying heavy duty stakes since I personally think the stakes that come with all tents aren't heavy duty enough.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kids and I to go camping for the first time. Fit my queen mattress and their 2 twin mattresses. It rained heavy for 2 hours one night, the next morning there was barely any water accumulated in the tent. I would recommend this tent to anyone. My three 13 y/o and I were able to put it up without any issues and take down was a breeze. Putting on the rain cover wasn't too difficult, we just tied it to the already set stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Obregon

customer_reviews.title: Humongous when up, compact when down
customer_reviews.text: Really big tent that easily fits three queen sized air mattresses. Easily enough assembled. Comes with a nice bag to store the tent when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey R.

customer_reviews.title: My 3 todller kids can still enjoy playing and wrestling inside specious room
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this tent and waited for several months before providing a review to test it in all weather conditions especially with water and rain. Overall, the tent serves my family of 5 really well especially our need of space inside the tent. My 3 todller kids can still enjoy playing and wrestling inside specious room. Rain and water tested as well when we were hit by a storm during camping. Recommended for large family size especially those with kids..
customer_reviews.author: Mac Fenomeno

customer_reviews.title: Great Space / Storm Ready
customer_reviews.text: I'm a stingy 5 star reviewer, but this tent is a winner. Great room - easily fit 2 queen air mattresses, one in each "wing" with as much room in the middle for sitting, bags, dog, etc. Had a wonderful lake trip, but got caught in a major storm for one night - 3 others in our group had issues with their tents in the water and wind, but my family was clean and dry (and slept right through the night) inside this baby! For a family camper ... I would recommend strongly. :)
customer_reviews.author: John D Eckhardt

customer_reviews.title: Good value and decent quality
customer_reviews.text: We got this tent for a camping trip to the desert. We needed to house our 4,10, and 18 year olds as well as my wife and I. Plenty of room and decent quality. I wouldn't want to pitch this at the base camp on Everest but it did well for a week and we expect at least a few years of service from this tent (car camping, for a week at a time 2-3 times per year). Good value with decent quality. I'd give it a solid B or B+ grade. I'm not sure how it would do in rain, but the rain fly seems adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan hale

customer_reviews.title: Lack of privacy from outside world
customer_reviews.text: This tent would be absolutely perfect if it weren’t for the windows. The windows have a major design flaw. Only the front and rear window have zippers/covers, and the two LARGE side windows do not. The only way you can get SOME privacy is if you keep the rainfly on. It does cover all of the unprotected windows, but it also means someone could push it to the side ever so slightly and peek in. So if you wanted to sleep without fear of someone potentially creeping on you, do not get this tent. As a young, adult woman, I will be returning this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Thinnakorn & Ash

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up!
customer_reviews.text: This guy was very easy to put up, and very spacious. The only down side are the flimsy thin stakes that come with it. We had plenty of room for a baby pack n play and king size mattress pad. I would suggest making sure to put down a tarp first.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Completely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! We just used it for our kids first camping trip and we had so much room! Plus it rained hard for a long time one of the nights and even though there was a puddle underneath our tent NONE of it came in! It’s completely waterproof! Super easy to put up and take down. Couldn’t be happier with my purchase! I’ll be purchasing more Core products after this experience. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zipper, great tent otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: After camping once in a mild climate, our zipper became jammed in the tent flap and resisted being opened. Finally once we got the zipper down, we realized that it ripped completely off of the tent body. Love everything else about this tent except the zipper is weak and cheaply made. If they can create a stronger zipper that won’t get caught in the material, this will be our forever tent.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Graham

customer_reviews.title: Big but came broken
customer_reviews.text: We had to return it because the tarp on top didn’t fit all the way across. Also one of the polls broke. The tent does offer a lot of space it fit 2 queen mattresses and our luggage and still had room but you have to be standing directly in the middle to change or change hunched over which I hate. Tent was super easy to set up and take down and loved the bag size to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: The tent is nice but it came with a couple flaws. First, one of the tie down hooks was missing but I gerryrigged one so that is no biggie. But one of the flexible wing poles broke the first night I put it up. I had noticed an anomaly on the pole but didn't think anything of it until it snapped in light wind that first night. I would like a replacement for that pole if possible. If not then where would I purchase such an item?? Anyway, when I get the pole issue straightened out, the tent will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie G

customer_reviews.title: Spacious, quality tent - human and dog approved
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great! I bought it for a long weekend trip with my fiancé and our 65 lbs. dog - went large to be able to fit a queen sized blow up mattress and a dog bed - and this was plenty (and I mean plenty) of room! We joked that it was a little apartment. The extra space was great for keeping our bags and my 6’3” fiancé was able to stand up inside to comfortably change. We also didn’t have any issues with water getting in, and the air vent and zippered windows helped with ventilation. Easy-ish installation for a first time tent-setter-upper, as well as take down. Overall highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tent!
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a week long trip with this tent. It would definitely have gotten 5 stars had it not leaked during a storm in 2 different spots. That being said it is super quick to put and take down. Overall a good tent except for the rain guard not working!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and nicely made!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent! We put 4 twin size coleman air mattresses inside and could've easily put one more. Roomy and airy with the entire top screened! The kids enjoyed looking up at the stars. The cover easily fits on top when you want it to. Cant comment on water resilience as it didnt rain, however, the tent was not wet in the morning at all. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: karen stein

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room, great value
customer_reviews.text: We had to buy a larger tent to fit our pack and play. This tent definitely has the room! When we first set it up the door didn't zip up very smoothly so be careful for the first couple of times! I think the fabric kind of stretched out so that issue went awaybadter a few uses. We have not camped I rain so I cannot comment on water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon Redberg

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality zipper, but great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I give this a two star due to the second time out camping, the door zipper pulled away from the seam. I've been camping 45 + years and never had a zipper fail after an actual 9 nights of camping. First time I've bought this brand. I have two smaller tents, very popular brand, that are still as good as the day I bought them. After emailing the company and sending a picture of the receipt and broken zipper, they shipped me a new tent. Great customer service
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: We had a great first experience with the tent. We really didn't have any bad weather so I can't comment on that. It did rain for a few minutes but we had tree coverage so we really didn't get wet. The only part that was a pain is the door zipper it likes to get stuck. It is easy to get unstuck just be gentle. Otherwise we loved it for first time camping with two little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for its buck!
customer_reviews.text: Used for 4 straight days at a festival and it withstood the summer weather. Held up great in strong rain and wind. The vents aired the tent out nicely during the heat. Excellent quality and very spacious! Don’t think 9 people could fit unless they all spooned, but it was comfortable and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Vladislav Loenko

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. My friends and I fit 5 twin air mattresses in. There wasn’t much space for anything except fans and the extension cord after, but if you have a car to put any excess luggage in it is a perfect fit. The only complaint I have is that the video and the instructions said nothing about the curved pole, so we could figure out what to do with it. The tent held up without it though  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Booth

customer_reviews.title: Great size and easy set
customer_reviews.text: Great tent overall. Plenty of room, for family of four and two huge dogs, and we can stand up inside. It kept out the rain for sure. Only issue is the rain fly doesn’t fully cover the end windows. It mostly does, but you can see out. Also, the main zipper is hard to zip up and down and seems cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Molly M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my family of five
customer_reviews.text: A perfect ten for my family of five. So easy to assemble. Ten minutes and we're up, even with the rain guard. Great air flow throughout and sturdy zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for a large groups for camping in the Spring, Summer or Fall. Altjough I would not recommend it for any type of Winter camping as it doesn't seem to have good insulation as the vent openings are all over the place. It's definitely a 2 person set up process and takes a little time but it's not insanely difficult and still only took me about 30 minutes. All the needed pieces were included and the material and construction seemed to be on point.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Went to the mountains for some camping and the weather turned poor quickly. It rained/snowed nonstop for 12 hours. This tent was the only one out of 4 tents that stayed dry the entire time. I was ready to start renting out space to my camping buddies who’s tents didn’t hold up to the harsh elements! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING TENT FOR FAMILIES
customer_reviews.text: I saw someone post a 3 year update and I decided then to get this tent. Took less than 10 minutes to set it up, we slept in it perfectly. Did have a muskrat, or some type of small animal try to get in last night, but held up nicely. No tears or rips. We have a family of 5, so we have plenty of room and could of added 5 more people. Holds up nice during the night time. Get really warm and cozy if left in the sun. I highly recommend this tent. Its awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Maryrose

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, big as expected I'm 6ft and can stand easy in this tent. It's a fully vented top that you throw a tarp on top of. It has a nice lantern and net shelf at the top and a hand full of pockets. Theres a lot of ventilation locations in this tent which is nice for hot days. The cord pocket door came in handy and was big enough to fit a three prong female extension cord through. I would definitely buy this tent again as I purchased it for $105! Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Moore

customer_reviews.title: Recommend CORE, just not this tent.
customer_reviews.text: Zipper failed 3rd trip. Only one window with rain cover. Decent tent but there are better ones out there. The material is quality the design is flawed. The tension on the door zipper is to much to hold up to frequent use. We got 2 1/2 years out of it before throwing away, but dealt with the flawed zipper for 2 years. I will but another CORE tent but pay more attention to design.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Caron

customer_reviews.title: The pole cracked on first set up
customer_reviews.text: The tent held up good in the rain and hail. But we set it up in our back yard for a trail run like normal and 1 of the tent piles broke. Like crack/shredded. So it was too late to send back and get another so we still used it but going forward I wld need to tape it and pray it doesnt shred more :-/
customer_reviews.author: gemicorne

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Finally got the chance to use this tent last weekend and i was impressed. Wanted something large enough for my girlfriend and i. Plus our 85 lb lab. Weather was perfect so not much wind and zero rain. Slept 4 adults plus a large kennel in the middle for my dog. could have easily slept more. overall very satisfied with this tent
customer_reviews.author: jcampa

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: So I've been sleeping in this tent on a camping trip since Tuesday, (it's Friday now) with my two children. Last night it rained quite a bit, and of course the tent ended up leaking RIGHT OVER ME. Other than that, it's nice and spacious. The zipper to the door sticks a bit. It was easy to set up, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it it's a great deal, big and doesnt break the bank
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huuuge! I'm 5'1 and I can stand in it with my arms raised up. Assembly/set up doesn't take long at all, my husband did it by himself in 15mins. The color is awesome, exactly as pictured. We dont how to will hold up on our 3day camping trip. I will come back to update. As for the price I think it's good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey

customer_reviews.title: It will leak in a rain pour
customer_reviews.text: I brought this tent for me and my daughters to go camping in but I decided to put it up in my backyard first to make sure that it's great for rain. So the first night the rain wasn't so bad and it did great. But the second night, the rain was pouring down and I checked it the next day. The tent leaked at the seams on the corners of the tent. I am still happy about the tent, but I just have to find something to really make it waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: CAHall

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the value.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is easy to assemble, the tent is also water-resistant, and has a cover that you can take off for a nice breezy tent experience. I really enjoyed using this tent. Another perk was when I disassembled the tent it fit in the bag! Most of the time the bag is only big enough to allow the factory-packaged tent to fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanseast7

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: This thing is big. Which is what we wanted. It only takes about 10-15 minutes to set up for two people, and probably quicker once you've done it a few times. Can't speak to how it handles water yet, as our first trip was completely rain free, but it looks like it'll handle it well based on the design.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R Kenward

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: We weren't sure what we'd get, but trusted other reviews enough to buy this tent.. and we were not disappointed, it is great! It has a ton of room for our family, and it is well built. We went from never camping to our boys wanting to go all the time, even if it's just in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: zenwheel

product_meta.title: Core 9 Person Extended Dome Tent
feature_bullets: Sleeps 9 people; Fits three queen air mattresses; Center Height: 72 inches
CORE H20 Block Technology and adjustable ground vent.Pole Type: Traditional Fiber Glass Poles
Features gear loft with lantern hook and pockets to keep items organized and off the tent floor
Electrical cord access port (port is fully closable when not in use)
Includes tent, tent poles, rain fly, tent stakes, and carry bag. All Core tents are equipped with water resistant PU coated fabric and taped seams to help keep moisture out

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
